metadata.title: CVE-2014-1829 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Requests (aka python-requests) before 2.3.0 allows remote servers to obtaina netrc password by reading the Authorization header in a redirectedrequest.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1829` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-requests - 2.2.1-1ubuntu0.1
python3-requests - 2.2.1-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: requests package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.1-1ubuntu0.1').
